Package AI

Class EdgePlacement

java.lang.Object
AI.Approach
AI.PlacementApproach
AI.EdgePlacement
public class EdgePlacement
extends AI.PlacementApproach
Edge Placement is a placement approach which tries to place all of the players ships along the edges of the playing grid
Author:
Tomáš Romancov

    EdgePlacement​(int rows, int columns, boolean spacing)

  • Constructor Details

    • EdgePlacement

      public EdgePlacement​(int rows, int columns, boolean spacing)
      Edge Placement constructor
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows on the playing grid
      columns - the number of columns on the playing grid
      spacing - whether or not ships can touch or should have at least a 1 tile space between them

  • Method Details

    • play

      public java.lang.String play​(game.Ship ship, char[][] grid) throws java.lang.Exception
      Finds a location where a ship can be placed. A ships are placed randomly around the edges. If there are no valid locations along the edges the ships are placed 1 square from the edge and so on.
      Overrides:
      play in class AI.PlacementApproach
      Parameters:
      ship - the ship currently being placed
      grid - the current playing grid of the player placing the ship
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception
